botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause a severe discomfort if ingested. Contact may cause a skin allergy. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Tulipa are bulbous perennials with characteristic flowers, in a wide range of colours, in spring
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Miscellaneous tulips include all species and hybrids not otherwise classified

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant 10 – 15cm deep in fertile, well-drained soil with shelter from strong winds and protection from excessive wet. See tulip cultivation for further advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by lifting and separating offsets
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove old flowers. Cut back foliage once the leaves died down turning yellow
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slug and snail damage, aphids and stem and bulb eelworm
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible tulip fire and bulb rots
